qas.question: What nanocrystals possess unique optical properties?
Quantum Dot LEDs can do what special skill?

answers.text: create almost any color on the CIE diagram

qas.question: The narrowing of the emission spectrum in Quantum Dot LEDs allows them to do what?
How many types of schemes are there in Quantum Dot LED excitation?
What non-nanocrystals possess unique optical properties?

plausible_answers.text: create almost any color on the CIE diagram

qas.question: Quantum Dot LEDs don't do what special skill?
The narrowing of the emission spectrum in Quantum Dot LEDs disallows them to do what?
How many types of schemes are there in non-Quantum Dot LED excitation?

context: <a0_0>Quantum dots<a0_0/> (QD) are semiconductor nanocrystals that possess unique optical properties. Their emission color can be tuned from the visible throughout the infrared spectrum. This allows <b4_0>quantum dot<b4_0/> LEDs to <a1_0><b5_0>create almost any color on the CIE diagram<b5_0/><a1_0/>. This provides more color options and <a2_0><b6_0>better color rendering<b6_0/><a2_0/> than white LEDs since the emission spectrum is much narrower, characteristic of quantum confined states. There are <a3_0><b7_0>two<b7_0/><a3_0/> types of schemes for QD excitation. One uses photo excitation with a primary light source LED (typically blue or UV LEDs are used). The other is direct electrical excitation first demonstrated by Alivisatos et al.
